title: Christmas Edition
description: Happy Holidays introduces Christmas to Minecraft! Don't understand the Grinches, Elves and Gingerbread Men that are now roaming your world? Fret not! This guide will serve as your gateway to all things Christmas in the module, explaining the various blocks, items and mobs that you may encounter throughout your adventure!

sections.content: Every year, Christmas in Minecraft has never been a huge deal, and this because there were all the special forces of Santa working in the background to make sure it didn't interrupt your day-to-day mining and crafting. One day however, Santa didn't secure his goods properly when travelling across the Overworld, and it seems that he's littered magic and items all over the Minecraft world! Now, Gingerbread Men roam the Overworld, presents are scattered everywhere, and it seems that Christmas has truly come to Minecraft!

sections.title: Your Goal
sections.content: Santa, in lieu of this embarrassing event, has enlisted your help in gathering his items. It's your job to gather the various legendary ornaments that are scattered across the world, and fill up the Christmas Star! Once that's done, Santa will come and give you some presents, depending on how good you've been!
Santa has given you the recipe for this book to help you in this journey. It's now up to you to save Christmas as best you can!

Welcome to Christmas! This book will guide you through the content added by the mod to Minecraft! The mod has also added achievements for you to unlock and follow along, so you don't get lost in various components of the holiday!

The ultimate goal of Christmas is for you to fill up the Christmas Star, a craftable block that can be filled up with any kind of ornaments. These ornaments can be gathered from various sources, which will be described in the later portions of this guide.

Note that although the Christmas Star does accept any ornaments, the legendary ones give the most bonuses. Depending on the tier of the star, buffs and bonuses will be given to you, the mobs and the blocks around it, so try your best to gather as many kinds as possible!

When Santa left the task to you, he requested that you call him using this star once your job was done. Only when you get all 5 ornaments will this power be made known to you, and Santa will personally come down to thank you for all that you've done. Beware, as his mood greatly depends on how naughty or nice you've been this season...

sections.title: The Star
sections.content: The Christmas Star is a seemingly fragile yet very powerful block that is available to you to craft. Using the magic harvested from legendary ornaments, it is able to bolster your abilities and also influence Christmas blocks and mobs around it.
Christmas Stars are not cheap; they do require some rarer metals in order to craft and be used.

Christmas Stars have slots for 5 ornaments, with each ornament giving a different amount of power depending on their rarity. The amount of power corresponds to different tiers, with power level 0 having tier 0 and power level 100 having tier 5, and the other tiers correspond to power levels at intervals of 20.

At each tier, the range of the star's power and its effectiveness increases. Players get more sturdy and stronger, entities are more likely to give you items you want and even presents seem to be more lucky when broken. Don't disregard how powerful this is; it will help you greatly in the quest of trying to finish collecting the legendary ornaments!

Once your star has reached an impressive tier, Santa will be ready to meet you and reward you accordingly. Be warned though: if you haven't been very nice this year, he might come bearing destruction instead of gifts!
To summon Santa, simply click the star in the middle of the Christmas Star interface. He will arrive soon after!

At the end of Santa's visit, he will have either willingly or unwillingly given you his hat, which has been specially enchanted (and is what actually grants him the power to enter houses via chimneys even though he's quite large). This can be put into the star itself for even more power, and due to how powerful it is, many of the effects that the star has is doubled!
Ornaments are blocks that are not only for decoration, but also have a functional use with the Christmas Star.

Ornaments come in three distinct rarities that are differentiable by the colour of their name. Common ornaments have a white colored name, rare ornaments have a cyan colored name while legendary ornaments have an orange colored name. How hard it is to get them depends on their tier, for example, common ornaments are easily obtained from most sources while legendary ornaments need you to complete specific tasks to obtain.

There are 4 different kinds of basic ornaments: baubles, big baubles, tinsel and christmas lights. These come in 6 unique colours, red, blue, yellow, green, gold and silver. The first four colours involve the use of their respective dyes, while gold and silver ornaments involve the use of iron and gold ingots respectively. An example of the recipe for baubles can be seen here:
Try obtaining the dyes and ingots to see the other recipes!
Rare ornaments come in the form of mob heads with string attached to them. They give better bonuses than common ornaments when put in the Christmas Star, but aren't as good as legendary ornaments!

Legendary ornaments are the best kinds of ornaments you can get in the mod, but they're also the most difficult to obtain! The later chapters of this guide book details how you would go about obtaining these ornaments.

When Santa lost control of his sleigh, he accidentally sprinkled some magic onto the Overworld below as well, causing all these mobs to appear all across the world. One of them was the Gingerbread Man, a friendly, albeit clingy passive mob that likes to roam about the Overworld. They wander about in groups, searching for purpose and trying not to get soggy.

sections.title: Sogginess
sections.content: Gingerbread Men are not exactly very sturdy fellows. Even a touch of water will cause them to turn soggy, and they can't really do anything about it! However, you can dry them off by placing them near a fire source, and they'll eventually dry up. Who knows, they might even give you some items as a reward, even a legendary ornament, maybe?

Gingerbread Men will drop their dough when attacked, or as a gift to players who have aided them. These pieces of dough can be crafted into Blocks of Gingerbread Dough, or cooked directly to obtain Gingerbread Cookies.

Gingerbread Blocks are relatively sturdy blocks that can be used for building, although they have the same weakness as their mob counterparts: water. Blocks of Gingerbread Dough can be cooked to obtain Blocks of Gingerbread. Blocks of Soggy Gingerbread can also be reheated to dry them.

Candy Canes were another item that fell off Santa's sleigh during the incident. They are tasty, craftable blocks that crumble into candy cane when broken. They also sometimes like to drop enchanted candy canes that have special uses!

Enchanted Candy Canes are a special, enchanted item that may drop when candy cane blocks are destroyed. They have various uses: they can be crafted into a legendary ornament with a piece of string, or can be put together with a bell to summon one of Santa's elves!

As the sleigh tossed and turned, the many presents that Santa was carrying scattered across the Minecraft world, littering the entire landscape. These presents can be found in any Overworld biome. Presents come in small groups (similar to pumpkins), and have three stages of growth: baby, adult and elder.

As long as they don't have anything directly above them, these presents are able to grow and in the process are able to hold more items for players to gather. These presents hold ornaments, sheet music amongst other items that were bound for the North Pole. They might even have higher chances to give better goodies, such as their legendary ornament!

Presents are very easily broken, and as a result breaking them causes them to tear apart into scraps. These scraps can be put together again to create a baby present that's ready to be grown once again! Larger presents will drop more scraps when broken!

The Grinch has been lurking in the Overworld of Minecraft, but hasn't seen a need to come out, until now! You'd better do your best to protect your presents; the Grinch will take any opportunity he gets to sneak up on them and break them to ruin Christmas! He's scared of players, so being around him will cause him to run away and stop anything he might be doing.
Although, the Grinch hasn't really seen the beauty of Christmas yet. Maybe wrapping a gift for him might not be such a bad thing...

Santa's Elves have always stayed in the North Pole, toiling away in his workshop to prepare presents for the rest of the world. However, due to the incident, it seems that they don't have enough materials to carry out their job! They've dispatched a few of them down to the world of Minecraft to gather whatever materials they can, attempting to earn money to recoup their losses.

Santa's Elves don't really have time to muddle about though; they do still have a job to do back at the North Pole. However, whenever you want to speak to one, be it to buy ornaments, sheet music or food, they'll be there in an instant! You can call one down by ringing the Santa's Elf Bell, craftable using an Enchanted Candy Cane and a bell.

Santa's Elves also do need your help in getting some of the items they need; they bring along with them a 'Toy Part Request', which is a list of items they need for building some of the toys in the North Pole. They're kind of in a hurry though, so they'll need you to complete it before they leave!

They aren't that stingy though; they know that this isn't a very easy job to do, and as such have brought along Christmas goodies and enchanted tools to reward you when you're done! They may even give you a special legendary ornament!

Where's the fun in Christmas if you can't give others some goodies for them to enjoy? Using a gift wrapper, you'll be able to wrap anything your heart desires and give it to others. Shake the gift fully to find out what others have given you!

sections.title: Giving the Grinch a Gift
sections.content: Other players aren't the only ones who need a gift this Christmas! The Grinch is one grouchy dude; giving him a gift might lighten him up a little and he might even give you something in return!
Along with all the ornaments and goodies Santa dropped was the Music Box. The Music Box allows you to play Christmas music, and can be easily crafted following this recipe:

Similar to how jukeboxes take CDs, a music box will take in sheet music and play the music that is written on it. These pieces of sheet music can be easily obtained from all the Christmas related sources!
There are a total of 16 pieces of sheet music that have been scattered in Minecraft; can you collect all of them?

Alongside the other ornaments are some non-ornament ornament-like items, such as Christmas stockings! These stockings are placeable on solid walls, and during the night they have a chance to be filled up with random goodies!
You might want to try placing them near Santa's favourite snack, Milk and Cookies. They say that it gets him to come more often...

This last chapter is dedicated to the jolly man. Santa is usually quite a relaxed guy, and tends to stay up north most of the year, planning for the annual Christmas season. Once in awhile however, he'll need to travel across the world to gather some items or meet some important people.
He's usually more careful and secretive about his presence, but it seems that this time, he's gotten a lot less sneaky!

Santa keeps track of how naughty or nice every Minecrafter has been during the season. He makes it simple: any time you kill an innocent being, you will become slightly naughtier. Any time you kill a being that deserves it, you will become slightly nicer. Helping the Grinch or the Elf will also put you in his good books.
Be warned though: don't harm his elves, or he'll come at you with a vengeance seen nowhere else!
Each player has a naughty-nice meter, and depending on the collective naughtiness and niceness of all players present, it'll determine whether Santa will come happy or angry!
Santa's Elf has snuck a few copies of Santa's List out from the North Pole to earn some cash on the side; if you'd like, you could get one from him!

Happy Santa is the kind of guy you'd want in the middle of a nice town square, paying a visit to the residents and bringing presents along the way. He comes with a bunch of gifts to reward your excellent help and behaviour!

Angry Santa is the kind of guy they would usually lock up. He's been experimenting A LOT with pyrotechnics and explosives, and he does have a slight anger issue, so you may want to be ready to deal with his bad temper...
Note: Knocking him out means that he will tend to drop more goodies for you!

Whichever way it goes, Santa will wake up back in the North Pole at the end, forgetting everything that happened, including your naughtiness or niceness! This means that you have a chance to prove yourself again to Santa!
Also, don't miss out on the Enchanted Santa Hat that he always carries on him!
This guide should serve as a good starter for a lot of the content that has been added for Christmas. Hopefully you do enjoy everything that has been added here!
Special thanks to E, who has always been supportive of the development of this mod and its various features. She was a big help in the ideation and features within this Christmas edition.
